casebody.data:
The State, ex rel. Pheils et al., Appellants, v. Bates, Judge, Appellee.

[Cite as State, ex rel. Pheils, v. Bates (1991), 62 Ohio St.3d 6.]

(No. 91-382 Submitted July 31, 1991 Decided September 18, 1991.) David R. Pheils, Jr. and Marshall D. Wisniewski, pro se.

Appellants, attorneys David R. Pheils, Jr. and Marshall D. Wisniewski, seek to prohibit appellee, Lucas County Common Pleas Court Judge James D. Bates, from enforcing an order requiring them to retain counsel in two actions before that court. Appellants cite Svoboda v. Brunswick (1983), 6 Ohio St.3d 348, 349, 6 OBR 403, 404, 453 N.E.2d 648, 649, to show that appellee has no

*7Sweeney, Douglas and Wright, JJ., concur. Holmes, J., concurs in judgment only. Moyer, C.J., H. Brown and Resnick, JJ., dissent.
